intro: Xanthophyllum novoguinense, commonly known as the New Zealand yellowwood, is a unique flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and woody structure. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Xanthophyllum novoguinense plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of New Zealand's flora.
